intro: Crepis hierosolymitana, commonly known as the Jerusalem ryegrass, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is a perennial herb characterized by its slender, upright stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in a composite head, typical of the daisy family. It is native to the Mediterranean region and thrives in dry, rocky soils. Crepis hierosolymitana is often found in open habitats such as roadsides and disturbed areas.
